title: Test
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Loss in million U.S. dollars, with a total of 7 data points.
Overall Loss in million U.S. dollars has increased over the Year

Loss in million U.S. dollars is rapidly increasing from 2013 to 2015, slightly decreasing from 2015 to 2016, rapidly increasing from 2016 to 2017, gradually decreasing from 2017 to 2018, and lastly roughly constant from 2018 to 2019.
The steepest increase occurs in between the Year 2016 and 2017.
Max Loss in million U.S. dollars about 1962.0 was recorded at Year 2017
Min Loss in million U.S. dollars about 74.0 was recorded at Year 2013
This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Loss in million U.S. dollars, with a total of 7 data points. The chart has 4 significant trends.
The longest trend is slightly decreasing which exists from 2017 to 2019.
Contrarily, the next significant trend is moderately increasing which exists from 2013 to 2015.
Additionally, the next significant trend is extremely increasing which exists from 2016 to 2017.
Likewise, the next significant trend is slightly decreasing which exists from 2015 to 2016.
